title: man loses 70lb without stepping
story: Man loses lb without stepping foot in gym and while enjoying regular mealsGavin Quinn, who writes for the Irish Mirror, shed the huge amount of weight in seven months while also rewarding himself with some snacks along the wayGavin Quinn before his weight loss Image: Belfast Live WSByGavin QuinnSports reporterGraeme Murray:,  Jan | commentsA man who lost lb without setting foot in a gym has shared his weight loss secrets. Gavin Quinn, a sports reporter, lost five stone in seven months with regular meals and exercise. The feat is even more astonishing because he did not once go to the gym during his weight loss journey. He puts his remarkable loss down to a combination of diet and exercise. Gavin, who writes for the Irish Mirror, shed the weight in seven months, but rewarded himself with some snacks along the way. BelfastLive reports that he had started to gain weight when he was a teenager.He said: I lost  poundsin seven months after deciding to make a change in October .Tipping the scales at around  stone, I wasnapost massively overweight but Iaposd noticed a gradual increase since I was a teenager that was accelerated by the initial Covid- lockdown.I looked into what I was eating and slowly turned around my diet and found cycling as a great way to get active to complement the changes Iaposd made. By Christmas I had lost over two stone and I kept it up in the New Year before hitting the five stone mark in May .  Gavinaposs weight continued to fall to  stoneand he eased off and worked on fitness goals rather than weight. He said for some people this was an epiphany moment similar to a favourite shirt no longer fitting them. Gavin added: But for me it was just a culmination of all the right things, I donapost have any overriding reason for making a change. At the time Ireland was staring at another Covid- lockdown which lasted seven months. Iaposd tried almost all of the aposfad dietsapos to no avail in the months and years before, and I could just feel my confidence was at an all-time-low, Gavin added. And on October , a Sunday morning, I said to myself that I need to make a change and that day would be day one. He tackled his eating and sleeping habits first and establishing a structure to his diet. Gavin gave himself a simple plan to start off with get eight hours sleep and have three meals a day at roughly the same time of day.  I set myself a rough target of , daily calories and used apps such as MyFitnessPal to help track what I was eating, Gavin added. Initially I didnapost pay too much attention to my macro-nutrients, but made an effort to ensure I was drinking plenty of water, eating foods with high fibre, vitamins and lower fat counts - particularly saturated fats. This meant I still had treats and snacks to enjoy, but the small changes slowly begin to add up and the , calories I consumed each day began to feel like more and more as the days and weeks went by. Some days it was , calories and other days it was , calories - donapost beat yourself up over going over your allowance every once in a while. Itaposs not about cutting yourself off from food, but rather improving your relationship with food.  The amazing thing about Gavinaposs weight loss was he did not join a gym. He never had great interest in the gym and hadnapost done when he was younger. Personally, I never took to the gym when I was younger and always liked to exercise as a means of engaging in a sport or activity, Gavin said. Gyms can be intimidatingyouaposve never become a member, but Iaposd suggest anybody looking to get active consider it. For me, I found a means to exercise in cycling - which has grown into somewhat of a passion for me over the past  months. Here are more of Gavinaposs aposs top tips on how he did it, from his diet to level of exercise:How did you manage your diet It can be dficult to follow a calorie deficit, when youaposre consuming less calories than youaposre burning your body is being forced to eat into fat reserves to fill that void. I made sure not to overdo it - deliberately eating just , calories per day can be too much and you could risk reverting back to old ways. Having my breakfast and lunches at very similar timeshelped build early eating habits that would set me up for the day. Again to ensure I wasnapost completely flipping my diet completely I used a degree of leniency when it came to dinner time, small changes like portion control and avoiding fatty foods when you have the option can make all the dference. Initially I found myself eating a lot of the same foods I already had, particularly snacks, but doing so meant Iaposd simply be eating less of what I used to rather than eating right. After the first week I began replacing some snack foods with lower calorie snacks, which in turn meant I had more calories to play with for my substantial meals. If I was eating a pack of  calorie crisps, Iaposd replace them with  calorie crisps, swap the Cadbury chocolate bars for lower calorie rice cake bars, treating myself to a zero calorie fizzy drink rather than a full sugar alternative. This meant I still had treats and snacks to enjoy, but the small changes slowly begin to add up and the , calories I consumed each day began to feel like more and more as the days and weeks went by. Some days it was , calories and other days it was , calories - donapost beat yourself up over going over your allowance every once in a while. Itaposs not about cutting yourself off from food, but rather improving your relationship with food.What are your favoured foods for weight loss Iaposve found so many great foods the past  months that I never enjoyed before, and Iaposd be confident in saying my relationship with food has really grown as I became more aware of what I was putting into my body. Hereaposs some of my favoured foods these days: Cous Cous: I sometimes use it as a lighter alternative to rice, itaposs easy to make and is high in carbohydrates and fibre.Rice crispy bars: Excellent for a quick snack, theyaposre a lot better than a bar of chocolate.Lentil curls: A low calorie alternative to many brands of crisps, Iaposve grown to love them.Nuts and seeds: A great snack, good source of protein and fats.Turkey burgers: Lean, high in protein and delicious - no explanation needed.Vegetables: Whatever they are eat plenty of them, theyaposre good for you and should be an essential pillar of your diet. Did you give up takeaways and alcohol Not really. Weaposve always had a aposTakeaway Fridayapos at home so I made sure to allow myself the Friday treat. Although instead of chips in the chinese takeaway some weeks Iaposd get rice or even eat a smaller portion. I initially gave up alcohol until Christmas, but when I did drink I opted for lower calorie light beers or spirits more often than not instead of calorie-dense lagers or stout.Do you need support to lose weight Everybody needs support when undertaking such a big change. Whether that be a personal trainer, or just a family member or close friend, Iaposd recommend you get someone on board to be there for support. In my case, I asked a close friend to act almost like my aposcoachapos to keep me honest. He would get in touch every now and then to see how I was getting on, was there to listenI had problems and cheer me on to my goals. Needless to say that educated professionals are much more qualied to play such a role, but having someone to bounce off and hold you accountable on the journey is essential.Did you almost give up Yeah, I came pretty close on November . I was making good progress in the weeks before but that morning I weighed in after a particularly tough week and had lost just one pound. In hindsight losing a pound in a week is a good achievement, but that week had been so dficult and the loss was a lot lower than I was expecting. I was agitated and questioning what I was doing for hours before I was convinced to take an hour to go on a short cycle to clear my mind. If I hadnapost walked out to get some headspace I wouldaposve broken and dialled back weeks of progress, especially since Iaposd already been fully committed to nearly a month. If youaposre about to give in - take a step back and remember why youaposre doing it.What do you doyou lose motivation Some days you just wake up and the same motivation you initially had just isnapost there - itaposll happen to everybody. Of course motivation is great, but it comes and goes. Behind the motivation you do need to have a certain amount of discipline. It can be very tough but you need discipline for when the inspiration and motivation just isnapost there. Weekly goals can help keep you focused.When did you start to see results The real goal wasnapost to get down to a certain weight or number, it was to feel good and take back some confidence that Iaposd probably lost. I started to notice a dference in how I looked around Christmas time , but had already felt better after about  days or so. I tipped the scales initially every week but increased that to twice weekly to avoid any discouraging fluctuations. Weighing yourself can be a good way of mapping out progress, but itaposs not the most important. If youaposre not getting the expected results one week, donapost get discouraged, itaposs important to make sure to keep doing the right things - the results will come.How important was exercise to your weight loss Quite important. I found a passion in cycling during my weight loss journey, but any form of exercise can give you similar results. Some people like running, walking, playing certain sports or of course the gym. It really doesnapost matter what your form of exercise is,you have a healthy and balanced diet then exercise is your best friend. Think of it as a complimentary relationship, the old saying of you cant out-exercise a bad diet can also be true for having a healthy diet but sitting on the couch all day. As little as a walk in the park, a short hike, leisurely bike ride or a dip in the sea can compliment whatever calories deficits youaposre creating and help you reach your goals faster. Butyou are taking on more rigorous exercise, itaposs important to ensure you arenapost creating too large of a deficit and are re-fuelling adequately.What are your golden rules for weight loss Everyone has their golden rules for weight loss, and although these particularly rules wonapost work for everyone, hereaposs a couple of mine: - Calorie deficit: If you create a daily calorie deficit, you will lose weight. Itaposs simple when you break it down like that. - Always treat yourself: Itaposs not about burning your bridges with certain foods, itaposs about improving your relationship with food. - Take your time: Thereaposs no rush, everyoneaposs bodies are dferent and once youaposre moving in the right direction thataposs all that matters. - Find your support network: Find someone to keep you on the right path and hold you accountable in the long run. - Exercise: Doesnapost matter what it is, get out there and get active. - Listen to your body: If youaposre hungry, eat something. If youaposre over-exercising, rest.Whataposs your advice to someone hoping to start their own journey If you were to take one thing from reading this, it would be my real golden rule. Sustainability. Whatever habits, calorie deficits or exercise regimes youaposre trying to put in place - you have to ask yourselfitaposs sustainable. When I set out to lose some weight, the one huge dference between all my failed attempts in the past was I asked myself is it sustainable  You should be trying to implementing a lestyle, not a aposlose weight quickapos hack. When you start on day one, ask yourself could you see yourself doing the same on day  or day   Because to lose weight and live a healthy and well balanced lestyle, whatever way you go about it needs be sustainable in the long term. title: mum barred pub bouncers being
story: Mum barred from pub by bouncers for being too ugly before they steal her phoneMiss Sidebottom, who was on a pub crawl in Manchester city centre, was attacked by bouncers who called her "too ugly" before the doormen stole her £ phoneClaire Sidebottom was attacked and robbed of her mobile phone by doorman Christopher Cash Image: Claire Sidebottom  Cavendish PressLtdByAlec Whitaker:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA mum-of-one was attacked by two bouncers who proceeded to steal her mobile phone after she began filming them as they barred her from a pub for being “too ugly”. Claire Sidebottom was grabbed by her handbag strap and forcibly pulled into a safety barrier at the Manchester city centre club, as she filmed the bouncers and was threatening to report them as they laughed at her. Miss Sidebottom, who was on a pub crawl, dropped the phone before hearing one of the doormen shout: “Grab it and run”. She never saw the £ device again. In a statement to police, Miss Sidebottom said the theft meant she lost sentimental photographs and was unable to be contacted by the hospital who were treating her poorly young son. She also said she had lost faith in door staff and did not want to go out in Manchester City centre again. Police who investigated the robbery found one of the doormen in possession of two kubotans - a weapon used in Martial Arts to place targeted force into pressure points on the body. He has since resigned from his job on the doors of Bar Rogue, in Piccadilly Gardens.  At Minshull Street Crown Court, Manchester, Christopher Cash, , from Edgeley, Stockport, admitted robbery, common assault and possession of an offensive weapon and was ordered to pay Miss Sidebottom £, compensation. The other doorman died unexpectedly before he could be charged. After the case full time mother Miss Sidebottom from Mossley said: aposaposI’m glad this manaposs been punished even though I don’t think what he got enough. He was a doorman and he was there to protect people not to bully, assault and rob. aposaposIt has been my first bar crawl for a while and I felt targeted and bullied and felt hurt because people were laughing with him. That evening I only went out to take my mind off what was going on around me at the time. aposaposI can’t even go out around town anymore now without feeling another bouncer will hurt me. This man took my phone that had sentimental pictures of my baby that I can never get back. He took memories away from me.aposapos The incident occurred on February  last year five weeks before the UK lockdown. Andrew Evans, prosecuting, said: aposaposThe defendant was a doorman at the time and Miss Sidebottom was on a night out and was queuing to get in. She encountered Mr Cash and his colleague but she recalls she was refused entry because staff said that she was too drunk and a dispute arose. aposaposDuring that time, she recalls them saying she was too ugly to be let in so she decided to record their behaviour on her mobile phone, asked for their names and threatened to send the footage to head office. aposaposShe then recalls one of the doormen grabbing her phone from her hand but she was able to grab it back. She asked them why they thought they could take this but then recalls one of the males coming at her through the barrier, causing her to drop the phone. aposaposShe recalled falling to the ground and the doorman saying ‘grab it and run’ to someone nearby. He looked up to see someone dressed in black running away and she never saw the phone again. CCTV shows Cash trying to grab the phone by reaching over the barrier, he then grabs hold of her bag and there is a physical confrontation. aposaposThe bag is around her neck and she was forced forward a few steps into the metal barrier. She fights back and gets back her mobile phone. But the other doorman then parts the barrier, steps towards the complainant and grabs the phone causing her to drop it. aposaposMr Cash picks it up and quickly moves out of the way and goes back inside the bar. During this period Mr Cash walks directly towards a hooded person who had been hanging around up the street. He hands the phone to him and the hooded man runs off across Piccadilly Gardens.aposapos Cash said he assaulted Miss Sidebottom when he lunged through the barrier dragging her forward by pulling the bag around her neck. He then stole her phone which had been dropped on the floor and handed it to an unknown hooded man. Officers recovered one kubotan from Cashaposs jacket pocket following his arrest and seized another when they searched his bag in the police station. In mitigation for Cash, who now works as a delivery driver, defence counsel Anna Chestnutt said: “He is a conscientious gentleman who does feel bad as to what happened to Miss Sidebottom. He says she did not deserve to be assaulted and the phone should not have been taken. He understands she deserves to be compensated. “He resigned from his role as a doorman as he felt that was a good thing to do to prevent this from happening again.aposapos Sentencing the judge Mr Recorder Daniel Prowse told Cash: “You were working with a colleague when Miss Sidebottom was refused entry to the bar as she was told she was too drunk. She recalls being told she was too ugly to be let in. “She recorded the behaviour of you and your colleague on her phone asking for your names and threatening to send the footage to head office. It would seem it was that which prompted the offending that followed. She recalls one of the doormen grabbing the phone from her hand and another coming through the barrier, which caused her to drop her phone. aposaposYou were the one who first came towards her and pulled her. You took the phone from the floor and you handed it to someone who left with it. It seems to me the purpose was to deprive her of evidence of your behaviour. You abused your power as a door supervisor in relation to her.” Cash was also ordered to complete a -month community order,  hours unpaid work and  rehabilitation requirement days. title: mum terrified after doctor told
story: Mum terried after doctor told her baby needs open heart surgery at just -months-oldIzabella Toole, of Liverpool, has celebrated her th birthday since undergoing the miracle surgery that saved her le - she had been born premature with a hole in her heartIzabella Toole was born prematurely at just  weeks Image: Liverpool ECHOByZoe PeckLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA baby underwent open heart surgery at just six-months-old after being born premature with a hole in her heart. Izabella Toole was born at just  weeks at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital weighing just . lbs. The tot initially appeared well but soon began having breathing dficulties and spent the first few days of her le in intensive care. Parents Eleanor and James, of Liverpool, Merseyside, were shell-shocked when doctors then gave them the devastating news that their baby needed open heart surgery. This was due to a condition called ventricular septal defectwhich meant Izabella had a hole in the wall separating her two heart valves.Eleanor, , told the Liverpool Echo : The size of the hole meant it wasnapost going to sort itself out.  We were told she needed the operation before she was two and we decided we wanted her to have it sooner rather than later. The whole thing was terrying. It was a whirlwind. You just have to trust the experts that youaposre in safe hands. We were shell-shocked. At the time I donapost think you can really grasp how dficult it is to go through that as a family. At six months old, Izabella underwent the gruelling surgery at Alder Hey Childrenaposs Hospital. On January , the family celebrated the  year anniversary of the operation that saved their daughteraposs le. James, , said: You talk about it, you cry we came out the other end as a family.  It was terrying and obviously a traumatic thing to let your child go through but we knew it was for the best. The family are still processing the trauma of Izabellaaposs early health issues and want to raise awareness of the importance of research into heart defects that made the operation possible. James described their now ten-year-old daughter as wonderful, laid back and happy with dreams of becoming a make-up artist. The couple praised the incredible care and regular check ups they received from Alder Hey. Eleanor said: All the staff were really supportive. They have us a support team that looked after us too and made sure we were okay. During her treatment, Izabellaaposs parents gave consent for their daughter to take part in research projects to further understand heart conditions. They raised more than £ for the British Hearth Foundation in  and now feel it is important to give back to the research that helped their daughter. Eleanor added: It was research that made Izabellaaposs operation possible. Without the people that went before Izabella, all those years and open heart surgery and research, Izabella wouldnapost be where she is. title: obsessed stalker who left model
story: Obsessed stalker who left model too scared to get pregnant walks free from courtSerial stalker Yusuf El-Habachi egan his campaign to torment Helen Green in  by repeatedly walking past her tattoo shop in Soho, central London and staring at herYusuf El-Habachi started his campaign of torment against model, Helen Green, in  Image: SWNSByGwyn WrightRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A serial stalker who left a model too scared to have a babywas again spared jail today.Yusuf El-Habachi, , began tormenting Helen Green back in  by repeatedly walking past her tattoo shop in Soho, central London and staring at her. The obsessed lurker also went into her tattoo shop, called One by One, and made lewd sexual comments. His cruel campaign stopped for five years, but he ed in  and carried on gorping at her through the window until she called the police. He was banned from contacting Green, who models under the name Arabella Drummond, for the rest of his le in October  under the terms of a restraining order. But Westminster Magistrates Court heard he breached the ban for a third and fourth time when he walked past her shop on Berwick Street on  July and  July last year. The paranoid schizophrenic was also in breach of a suspended sentence imposed for breaching the restraining order. In addition, he performed a sex act in front of another woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, on a bus in East London, on  July last year. El-Habachi, of Forest Gate, east London, later told police he was just aposdoing something with my trousersapos despite being caught in the act on CCTV. He also stole cans of Red Bull from a Greggs store on  July last year. He admitted exposure, theft, one count of breaching a restraining order and breaching a suspended sentence at previous first appearances before a magistrates court. The defendant admitted a second count of breaching a restraining order on the first day of his trial in November last year. His  week jail term was suspended for a year and a half and he was told to carry out  rehabilitation days and live under an pm- am curfew for  days. He must also pay £ compensation to the exposure victim and £ in court costs. An application by prosecutors to make him abide by a Sexual Harm Prevention Order was thrown out. Ms Green said she wants to have a baby with her partner, but has so far been put off trying for one because she is worried about the effect more encounters with her stalker will have on the child. She added: Thisincident has made me feel extremely devastated that this has started all over again. I have had to deal with this man for so many years and I fear coming to work or going to lunch. This situation is affecting my relationship with my partner and there are days when I want to leave the country. There have been days of crying and worrying. I am tired of losing my le over this male and I just want this to end. I feel constantly in danger. Luke Staton, prosecuting, said: At around  am on  July last year a woman boarded a bus and around two stops later the defendant boarded the bus and sat to the right of her in the back row. She could see out of the corner of her eye that there were some movements coming from the defendant. When she looked towards him, she could see him he was masturbating with one hand while he looked at her and aposside-eyedapos her. The victim went to the driver to explain what happened and while she was doing that the defendant got off the bus. She asked the driver to report the incident and the defendant was caught on CCTV and identied. When interviewed by police the defendant made no comment other than to say aposI was not masturbating, I was just doing something with my trousers.apos On  July last year, in breach of a restraining order imposed on  October , the defendant was seen on Berwick Street by a member of staff who works with Ms Green. There was no communication at all between the defendant and the victim. He walked past the store and glanced towards it for around two seconds. On  July last year the defendant was seen by the victimaposs manager walking past the store briefly and looking in the direction of the store before walking on. The reason the restraining order was imposed was because he was walking past the store several times every day in the past. Mohammed Naqvi, in mitigation, said: The defendant has been diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia and is close to being diagnosed with autism. He used to live with his elderly mother who is ill but since September he has been living in supported accommodation. He is now receiving much better, intensive, daily support. He has also been offered treatment at a stalking clinic which would help him. Prison would have a detrimental effect on his mental health which could deteriorate drastically as prison would be quite frightening for him. He could lose his place in supported accommodationhe were to be sent to prison today. He can undertake rehabilitation days as part of a community order. The court can follow the probation report and spare him prison today. In regards to the breaches of the restraining order, he has walked past, there has not been any interaction and on one occasion the victim had to be notied about. District Judge Neeta Minhas told him: You cannot commit any further offences or breach any orders. If you do anything like that you will go to prison. I am not sure how many more chances can be given to you. The reason I have not sent you to prison is because you are in supported housing. You will lose thatyou go to prison. You would be in a worse positionyou were to lose that, and society would be put at greater riskyou lose your housing. You have run out of chances this is probably your last. If you breach the order or offend again, not even your personal circumstances will be able to keep you out of prison. title: ryanair passenger blasts birmingham airport
story: Ryanair passenger blasts Birmingham Airport after he hops down stairs with ankle injuryRetired NHS biomedical engineer, Dr Neil Stafford, claims he asked Ryanair for a wheelchair at both ends of his flight from Birmingham Airport to Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands after he ruptured his achilles while on holidayRyanair passenger Dr Neil Mallett, who sustained an injury on holiday, was appalled after he had to hop down stairs at Birmingham Airport because airport staff wouldnt help him Image: Dr Neil Mallett BPM MEDIAByJosh SandordRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments An injured Ryanair passenger who ruptured his Achilles on holiday was appalled when he says airport staff refused his request for help and he had to hop down a flight of stairs.Retired biomedical engineer Dr Neil Mallett claims he was also forced to balance on one leg as he boarded a bus to the terminal to avoid putting pressure on his painful injury.The former NHS worker claims he asked budget airline Ryanair to have a wheelchair ready at both ends of his flight back from Fuerteventura to help him move around the airport, Birmingham Live reports.Ryanair claims Neilaposs request was made on the day of his flight, and therefore went against their -hour notice policy. The -year-old said staff at his holiday destination assisted him, while Birmingham Airport staff did not. When he left the plane on his , flight attendants told him nobody was available to help, he claims. With no airbridge between plane and terminal, Dr Malliett was then forced to hop down the stairs from the plane to the tarmac.  To compound matters, he said he then had to stand on one foot during the bus journey to the terminal building. No one at all assisted me at BHX except a young lad at border control who got me through quickly, Dr Mallett., from Stafford in the West Midlands, said. Ryanair has never got back to me and BHX have not been very helpful, to say the least. I have been in plaster for three weeks now.  Hopping down the stairs is likely to have not helped as it was later confirmed I have a ruptured Achilles. Since the ordeal, Dr Mallett, who is supposed to be flying from Birmingham again next month, has been tweeting both the airline and airport asking for answers. He said he is now apprehensive to fly from the airporthe still requires help.  In one tweet he wrote: Pretty crap last week I must say. No help for me walking down the plane steps and then standing on a bus after asking for assistance. I wonderthat is what ruptured my Achilles  In another, he added: Six days now with no answers. Not sure Birmingham Airport is the place to fly fromyou are disabled, never mindyou are brave enough to rough it with Ryanair. A spokesperson for Ryanair said: Mr Mallet requested special assistance on the same day of his flight. In order to guarantee the availability of special assistance, Ryanair requires passengers to request these services a minimum of  hours before the scheduled flight departure time. These requirements are outlined on our website, where Mr Mallet requested the service.” Birmingham Airport has been approached for comment. story: Secrets of Kate Middletons th birthday photoshoot - private shots, dancing and Georges feedbackThe photographer behind Kate Middletons th birthday portraits, Paolo Roversi, has spoken out on news uk-news secrets-kate-middletons-th-birthday-"Kate Middleton releases photographs to mark th birthdayByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Royal fans had been hoping the Duchess of Cambridge would release new official photos to mark her th birthday - and they were not disappointed.Three beautul portraits were shared for the occasion - each showing Kate in a dferent light.In two of the images, she wears flowing light dresses while in the third she dresses up in a vibrant ruby red gown - completing the look with loose curly hair and natural-looking make-up. The pictures were snapped during a secret photoshoot at Kew Gardens last November by famous fashion photographer Paolo Roversi, whose previous work has graced the pages of Vogue and Vanity Fair. And Mr Roversi has opened up on exactly how he came to work with Kate and how he also snapped some special photos that are likely to remain private... First meeting The first meeting between Kate and Mr Roversi came last November at Kensington Palace, where the photographer says they met for tea and biscuits.And during this meeting, he says he found Kate a little nervous about carrying out the shoot.He told Italian newspaper Corriere della Sera : “At first the Duchess was apprehensive. She is machine-gunned by photographers every day but is not used to posing.“Knowing my photos with models she was a little fearful of facing a real session, which required about four hours of work. But I reassured her that once we started it was going to be very easy. Dresses and jewellery Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.In the portraits, Kate wears three absolutely stunning dresses created by a designer who sheaposs worked with numerous times in the past - Sarah Burton for Alexander McQueen.Sarahaposs relationship with Kate goes back more than  years as she also created her iconic wedding gown. And it appears her trust in her is steadfast as itaposs been reported Kate allowed Sarah to pick the dresses for the shoot. For the official portrait , Kate wears a stunning light organza dress, which Mr Roversi says makes the duchess look like a classical ballerina.In terms of jewellery, Kate wears her eye-catching engagement ring and in two of the shots, opts for a pair of diamond earrings on loan from the Queen.While in the photo where she wears the red dress, she wears diamond and pearl drop earrings that once belonged to her late mother-in-law Princess Diana.Hair and make-up  When it came to Kateaposs hair and make-up, the photographer was keen for a less is more approach, with a no defined hair style and little make-up. He told the Italian publication: “I didnapost want her to look too Lady Duchess, too establishment, but as pure and contemporary as possible. Or even timeless.” On the shoot  While taking her picture, Mr Roversi said he was moved by Kateaposs warm and friendly welcome and enchanted by her shining eyes that reflected the loveliness of her soul and her smile showing the generosity of her heart. He added: It was a profound and rich experience for me, an unforgettable moment. I have met a wonderful person, a person who, with her positive energy, can bring hope to the whole world. The photographer also revealed that for some of the images he took, he persuaded Kate to dance and twirl across the floor - something sheaposs rarely done in public. He said: In the end I wanted to take some moving pictures, so with that wonderful wide skirt I made her dance in front of my lens, a sort of accelerated waltz mixed with a pinch of rock aposnapos roll. But unfortunately, he says these dancing images are likely to remain private and have not been released. Selecting the images After the shoot, the photographer was left with a set of around  pictures, which he whittled down to .He says he and Kate then worked together to choose the three final portraits. The Italian newspaper suggests that Prince William and their childrenaposs favourite shot is the one where she looks directly into the camera.The photos, part of the National Portrait Gallery’s Coming Home exhibition, will go on display in Berkshire, where Kate grew up, St Andrews, where she met Prince William, and Anglesey, their first marital home.And yesterday, Kate thanked her many well-wishers on Twitter, in a rare personal tweet. She said: Thank you for all of your very kind birthday wishes, and to Paolo and the National Portrait Gallery for these three special portraits. C. title: two brit cabin crew claim
story: Two Brit cabin crew claim they were drugged and sexually assaulted at LA partyOne of the victims is claimed to have told her colleagues about her ordeal after breaking down in tears during a flight back to London from the US city of Los AngelesThe woman claim they were drugged and sexually abused in LA Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Jan Police are investigating claims that two British airline cabin crew were drugged and sexually assaulted at a party. The alleged victims told friends they were targeted during a party in Los Angeles while they were in the city with work. The women said they went to the party after visiting a nightclub. One of the victims is claimed to have told her colleagues about her ordeal after breaking down in tears during a flight back to London, it has been reported. The politan Police told the Mirror an investigation had been launch after a “third party” reported the claims to officers at Heathrow Airport when the plane arrived. A source told The Sun of the alleged incident: “The women were working abroad and let their hair down one evening. They went to a posh club in Los Angeles and from there they went back to a mansion.They claim that they were drugged and sexually assaulted while they were at the mansion. It’s all very serious.” The women are claimed to have worked for several years for their airline - which has not been identied.  A spokesman for the company told The Sun: “We are aware of reports that crew members may have been involved in an incident while overseas. “We take such matters extremely seriously and are providing them with full support.” A Met Police spokesman told the Mirror: “Police at Heathrow were informed by a third party that two members of an incoming airline cabin crew had allegedly been sexually assaulted in the US. Our inquiries are ongoing.”Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON politan PoliceHeathrow Airportsex attackCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman 32 wakes up discover
story: Woman, , wakes up to discover she couldnt walk or talk after stretching her neckHelen Farrell initially dismissed the pain as a migraine but when she woke up unable to move doctors revealed she had torn an artery in her neck by stretchingHelen had been stretching her neck, the day before she was rushed to AE with a torn arteryByHollie BoneNews ReporterCharlotte Penketh-KingRamazani Mwamba:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA woman woke up to discover she couldnapost walk or talk after stretching her neck tore an artery and caused a stroke.Helen Farrell, , was moving her head side to side when she experienced a sharp pain in the back of her head, but initially dismissed it as a migraine. When she woke up the next day from a nap, she was terried to discover she was unable to move or speak properly and was rushed to AE, Manchester Evening News reports.The professional singer, who has been forced to cancel all of her gigs until February, was left stunned when doctors told her she had suffered a stroke caused by stretching her neck.Helen from Blackpool told the MEN: As soon as I woke up, this pain in my ear started - it was this loud, tingling, wooshing sound, like tinnitus. I tried to get up but I couldnapost walk or talk and I was being violently sick. The doctors have now said that I had had a stroke which was from me tearing the main artery going into my brain when I stretched my neck. Helen had previously visited chiropractors over the years and was shown exercises and stretches to help ease stfness in her neck. She had been on her living room floor moving her head from side to side when she felt sudden pain at the base of her neck. Taking painkillers she dismissed it as a migraine but was concerned when the pain still hadnapost gone later that day. With a singing gig scheduled in the afternoon she laid down for a nap in a last ditch attempt to sht the headache, but when fiancé, Andy Eastwood, , woke her an hour later she couldnapost control her body. Helen said: He woke me up and I was unable to talk - I was just slurring and couldnapost get what I wanted to say out. I tried to move and I couldnapost move my legs. Every time I moved, I was swerving - theyaposve since told me I was experiencing vertigo - and I was getting this really harsh pain in my ear like a rattling sound. I could move my left arm fine but the right one was uncontrollably swaying everywhere, and I was being violently sick for about three hours. Musician Andy rushed Helen to AE where tests revealed that she had suffered a stroke after tearing the main artery in her neck during her stretches. Doctors wrote in her medical notes that the tear, known as a bilateral vertebral artery dissection, had occurred following a aposneck massage and stretching exercisesapos, triggering a stroke. Helen was relieved when her ability to talk ed but to her horror, she quickly discovered that the stroke had robbed her of her singing voice. In a normal week, she makes around £ through singing gigs, and with all her jobs cancelled up until next month, sheaposs looking at a loss of around £,. Helen ordinarily makes around £ a week through singing gigs, and with all her jobs cancelled up until February , sheaposs looking at a loss of around £,. She said: Now Iaposm back home and I want to get back to normal, the severity of it has hit. Singing is my way of living but Iaposm having to cancel all my jobs and thataposs after a year of no singing work because of lockdowns. Itaposs like Iaposve never had a singing lesson in my le, it just sounds so weak and uncontrolled, itaposs all gone. My partner is a multi-instrumentalist so heaposs been playing music for me every day and I try to sing along and I can see a little improvement butI do just one song, Iaposm tired - it takes it out of me. Iaposm worried about when, or , Iaposll get back to work. The doctors didnapost speak much about my singing voice, they were more bothered about my speech and my walking. Iaposm trying my best to stay positive. Iaposm still so grateful that I can walk and talk now because I couldnapost even do that when the stroke first happened, but obviously, I do feel worried and sad that I canapost sing. title: im sick sister being rude
story: Im sick of my sister being rude so I confronted her - our parents are fumingA woman left her family ided after she took it upon herself to tell her little sister the harsh truth about why she had no friends, and now her parents have accused her of bullyingA woman ided her family after telling her little sister why she had no friends Image: Getty Images Tetra images RFByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A woman left her family ided after she explained to her younger sister that the reason she doesnapost have any friends is because of her personality - as sheaposs not nice enough to others.Sharing her story anonymously, the woman said that her sister, Nora, is just  but despite her age, she has already been recognised for her intelligence. Nora is described as aposhighly gtedapos, and the youngster has let this news go to her head, so much so that she refuses to listen to her aposunqualiedapos teacher or team up with other students in her class who are aposintellectually inferiorapos. Trying to help her sister, the woman decided to tell her she had to be nicer to the other children - but the youngster didnapost like that, and now her parents have accused her of bullying the youngster. What do you think of the sisteraposs actions  Let us know in the comments... Taking to Reddit, the woman said that her story began when she was giving her little sister a lt home.She said: I turned around and told her something pretty close to, aposNora, you aren’t friendless because everyone  is intellectually inferior, you’re friendless because of your nasty attitude. You may think you’re the smartest kid in the room, but you won’t go anywhere in le until you learn to treat people with respect, much less make friendsapos. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. It was something I’ve wanted to tell Nora for a very long time. My sister was stunned and was completely silent for the rest of the car ride. After dinner, once my parents were home and Nora was in her room, my parents basically laid into me for what I told Nora. They said how I was basically bullying Nora and telling her how she should aposhold herself back when she’s exceptionalapos. After sharing her story online, the woman was inundated with support from other Reddit users who said that she was in the right for speaking out. One said: You gave your sister a reality check your parents should’ve. Theyaposre the true a******s in this story, raising a spoiled brat. And then a second wrote: Your sister is exceptional - exceptionally rude, ignorant, disrespectful, out of touch, socially maladjusted, entitled, spoiled, and stunted. I am impressed that you said what you said and nothing more. While a third said: She should know better and treat people with respect. She needed a reality check, you didnapost scream or yell, you didnapost tell her that sheaposd never have friends. You just told her the truth.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news weird-news mcdonalds-worker-shares-how-makes-"McDonald’s worker shares how he serves those that demand ‘fresh fries’ByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Oct Updated:,  Jan | commentsWe all love a trip to McDonaldaposs. From a classic Big Mac to the new vegan McPlant, thereaposs something for all of us. And itaposs hard to argue that their salty golden French Fries arenapost better than other chains - although, of course, that is subject to personal choice. One McDonaldaposs worker went viral after releasing a video showing how he treats rude customers who demand fresh fries.Deandre Byars, who claims to work at the fast-food restaurant, told viewers to stop being rude to staff in a now-viral TikTok video on the , where heaposs known as @dresav.In the clip, he jokily revealed what happens when you demand fresh fries at McDonaldaposs.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Instead of making a fresh batch, as you may have expected, Deandre simply reheats them. He begins by throwing the cooked chips that are sat in a heating station back into a frying basket to dip them in the oil for a quick fry. He leaves it in there for a few seconds before taking them out and putting them back into the packaging. Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and thousands of comments from ided viewers. One person said: How is asking for fresh fries rude  I swear people love to do the bare minimum, to which Deandre replied saying: Demanding and asking are two dferent things. Another joked: “Then you have to remake them because we all know they’re not fresh and complain, so you’re really playing yourself. A third person said reheating the fries is unsafe because the salt ruins the oil. But surprisingly, the majority of people didnapost seem to care as long as their chips were warm. Lol thataposs fine as long as theyaposre hot, one said.  Another added: Literally as long as they arenapost cold, tough or soggy [I donapost care]. If that fixes it then Iaposm cool with it. While someone  advised: Always ask for fries with no salt and they will a hundred per cent be fresh! Bring your own salt! This isnapost the first time a McDonaldaposs employee has shared store secrets.Katie, known as @katieeclarkee on TikTok, has explained why they take your picture when youaposre using the drive-thru.During her sht, she showed viewers the drive-thru camera and demonstrated how it works.Take a look here. Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: my sister law said ruined
story: My sister-in-law said I ruined her wedding - all I did was cut my hairA woman took to Reddit to ask usersshe was in the wrong for cutting her hair after her sister-in-law blamed her for ruining the aesthetic of her dream wedding Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsMost brides have an exact image in their heads of how they want their wedding to go. So when one woman cut off her hair before the big day, the bride was not happy.Posting on Reddit, the woman, who was part of her sister-in-lawaposs bridal party, explained that she decided to undergo a big hair transformation, swapping her long s for a short pixie cut Thrilled, she posted a selfie of her new do on Instagram, but her sister-in-law was less than impressed.The bride-to-be flipped her s**t, saying how she had destroyed her wedding aesthetic, and that she shouldnapost have cut her hair at all. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. She also received a slew of nasty texts from the maid-of-honour. I sent them to both my mom and brother. My other sister, a bridesmaid, pulled out of the wedding party, she said. There’s been an epic fight between my brother’s family and my [sister-in-lawaposs] family over my hair. Reddit users were quick to defend the woman and assured her she wasnapost in the wrong, slamming the brideaposs behaviour. One person said: Any bride who loses her sh*t over her aposwedding aestheticapos needs to sit down and reevaluate her le choices. Another wrote: If she wanted you to have a certain hairstyle then she needed to communicate that when asking you to be a bridesmaid. [Not the a**hole] your hair, your choice. A third commented: Bridezilla is clearly on a warpath. Better to not associate with that as much as you can. Shows who she is as a person, NOT you. While someone  said: You are so very much [not the a**hole]! You don’t ask people to be in your wedding party because they round out your aposaestheticapos, you do it to honour their place and importance in your le . The bride-to-be’s priorities are way out of whack. She’s treating you like an accessory to her aposbig dayapos instead of a human being. I bet you look fantastic! The fact that this has totally blown up is awful, just certainly not your fault!Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: seemingly innocent house sale 590k
story: Seemingly innocent house on sale for £k - with strip club hidden in the basementA five-bedroom property, located on a quiet cul-de-sac, is surprisingly equipped with booze-filled fridges, black booths, a pool table, neon signs, a large bar area and stripper poleThe home appears rather innocent Image: Jam Press Kohlmeyer RemodelingByLiam GilliverOpinion WriterRia Newman:,  Jan | comments An innocent seeming house with a secret nightclub and strip club hidden in the basement has gone on the market for £,. The property, which boasts five bedrooms and . bathrooms, is located in a quiet cul-de-sac in Indianapolis, US, and appears to be a regular family home from the outside.It features a large swimming pool and decent-size decking space, perfect for entertaining. Nothing seems suspicious when you enter the , square foot pad either. It is elegantly decorated with wooden accents throughout and has a grand dining table perfect for a family, which lies under an impressive chandelier.  Want an escape from the doom and gloom  Share your email for all the fun and heartwarming stories of the day from the Mirror However, potential buyers may be in for a bit of a shockthey head down to the basement - which has been converted into a nightclub complete with booze-filled fridges, black booths, a pool table, neon signs, a large bar area and space to dance. Thereaposs also a makesht strip club with a stage, dancing pole, disco ball and large viewing sofa. Viewers were stunned by the secret nightclub after pictures of the house were shared online. “I live just across the border in Illinois. That may really be the hottest club in Indiana, one person said.  Another added: “Business in the front, party in the back. Someone  commented: “Ultimate house for introverts, you can go out and stay in at the same time!”If partying isnapost for you, you might be interested in the striking two-bedroom house that went on the market for a much more affordable £,.The catch  The gothic octagon-shaped house is painted entirely black - both on the inside and outside. Owner Seth Goodman decided he liked the dark colours and redecorated the outside of his home after buying it last year, but hasnapost had any offers despite the low price.  I was interested and thought at first I was just going to flip the house, but after my home sold, I needed a place to live, Goodman told the Lincoln Courier.I wanted to make it more modern and after seeing the black roof, I thought why not go with black siding. From there we used black gutters, painted the deck black and changed the landscaping rocks to black.Which house would you want to buy  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON property newsViralNightclubs" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news woman-discovers-what-travelodge-logo-"TikTok user shares her shock at Travelodge logoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Sep Updated:,  Jan | commentsMany of us have stayed in a Travelodge over the years - but thereaposs something you might have missed. The hotel chain is a popular choice when looking for somewhere to rest your weary head at the end of the day. And while you might have glanced at the logo once or twice, itaposs possible youaposve not given it any real thought. If you have, you might have thought it featured rolling hills - but it turns out that is incorrect. TikTok user Charlotte @chxrll claimed on TikTok that it actually features someone sleeping. Can you see it  She shared her revelation about the logo in a video that has since gone viral on the video-sharing  - and left people shocked. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. It more than hundreds of thousands of views from people who were just as stunned as she was to find out the truth. My dumb ass thinking about how the Travelodge logo is a person sleeping… she wrote, as she munches on crisps. She then shows a picture of the logo and added: For years I thought it was hills! Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and  comments many of which were shocked by the revelation and shared what they believed the logo was.  One person said: S**t I thought it was a seagull. Another commented: Iaposve never seen that before in all my le I thought it was just colours. A third wrote: NO WAY. been living a lie my whole le. Even an employee of the hotel chain admitted they didnapost know, as they admitted: I work for Travelodge and Iaposve never realised. But it turns out this wasnapost news to everyone as one person said: Am I the only one that has always known itaposs a person sleeping  I feel kinda special not gonna lie. The Mirror has contacted Travelodge for comment.What do you think the logo resembles  Let us know in the comments.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TravelodgeViralTikTok" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman shares look inside smart
story: Woman shares look inside her smart home and is told shes living in A TikTok user has stirred opinions online with her futuristic apartment, which features everything from an electric biometric finger lock to a self-stirring coffee mugThe smart home has stirred opinions online - with some users branding the gadgets unnecessaryByLiam GilliverOpinion Writer:,  Jan | comments A woman has been told sheaposs living in the year  after showing the inside of her gadget-filled smart home. TikTokker MyKoreanHome has raked in an impressive . million likes and . million followers due to her futuristic appliances and home furnishings.After entering the apartment using an electric biometric finger lock, the tech lover often videos herself using a disinfection sprayer gun before making her way into the kitchen in heated slippers. But cooking and cleaning is easy when you have a self-stirring coffee mug, automatic bin, sterilising kne holder, mini juicer, fridge purier, automatic mop and vegetable cleaner. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.The bedroom is also filled with innovative products including a wireless-charging night table, cosmetic fridge for face masks and skincare, a flame air humidier night light as well as a Bluetooth speaker and wireless charger that doubles as a lamp. In her most viewed video, MyKoreanHome also shows off the automatic soap and toothpaste dispenser in her bathroom, as well as a portable glasses cleaner, and an adorable air dfuser. Many users have hailed the TikTokker for living in the future with one person asking: Girl are we in  because I donapost know what year I am in  Another added: “She’s living in the year . However, the gadget-filled home has received some criticism, with many blasting MyKoreanHome for owning an unnecessary amount of items.People have also joked that her electricity must be sky high - and that everything looks expensive but cheap at the same time. In fact, some are dubbing the apartment the Shein house - named after the fast-fashion giant brand which has come under fire over the quality of its garments.If you want to replicate MyKorenHomeaposs interior - you can - but it may break the bank. The staraposs website sells all gadgets featured in her videos, with many items costing more than £. However, some users have pointed out that similar items can be purchased from retailers such as Amazon for a cheaper price.Have you turned your pad into a smart home  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TikTokViralSmart Phone" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman slammed stopping boyfriend being
story: Woman slammed for stopping boyfriend from being his childhood friends best manA woman took to Reddit to ask users whether she was unreasonable for not telling her boyfriend that she doesnt want him to be a part of his best pals wedding over a feud with the groom-to-bes fiancéeHis pal had asked him to be his best man Image: Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman has been slammed online after she told her boyfriend that he couldnapost be his close friendaposs best man at his wedding.Posting on Reddit, the -year-old shared the exciting news that she and her boyfriend of two years are expecting a baby.But conflict arose when her boyfriend was asked to be his childhood friendaposs best man at his wedding. She explained that the two couples used to be really close until the soon-to-beaposs groomaposs fiancée betrayed her and went behind her back.Despite not being included in the wedding party, her boyfriend offered to bring her along, in case issues arose with her pregnancy — but she refused, and told him she doesnapost want him to go along either. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. I told him that I wasnapost going to sit through and watch someone who betrayed me celebrate love, she wrote. I lost it and told him thatIaposm not going to the wedding, then he shouldnapost be his best man and should prioritize me and the baby. Itaposd be awkward with his fiancéI went, and his best friend can find someone  to be his best man. I told some of my friends this, and they said though the pregnancy is important for him to be attentive to, I should move on from the drama and let him be there for his best friendaposs big day. She concluded her post by asking whether she was in the wrong, and many users were quick to point the blame at her. One person said: [Youaposre the a**hole]. You can sit at home pregnant and p***y, but you have no right to tell your boyfriend he canapost be the best man in his best friendaposs wedding. aposI’m not going to sit and watch someone who betrayed me celebrate loveapos more than sealed it for me, said another. [Original poster] is simply being overly dramatic and holding a grudge. Now she’s punishing her boyfriend because he isn’t holding the same grudge on her behalf. Someone gossiped about her so they don’t deserve to be loved  Give me a break. A third added: Couldn’t have said it better myself. What a selfish person. What do you think  Whoaposs in the wrong here  Let us know in the comments.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: bride rushes out covid nightclub
story: Bride-to-be rushes out to get Covid in nightclub to not ruin wedding in  weeks timeA bride-to-be posted a video of herself on TikTok darting around a club in Melbourne, hugging revellers and sharing drinks, in an "unwise" bid to try catch Covid before her big day in six weeksAn unidentied TikToker posted a video of herself carrying out her plan of getting infected with Covid to avoid her wedding day being ruined in six weeks Image: maddysmart TikTokByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A bride-to-be hugged partygoers and shared drinks in a club as part of her mission to catch Covid- now so it doesnapost ruin her wedding day in six weeks.The woman was seen flouting the social distancing concept as she darted around a swanky nightclub in Melbourne, Australia months before she ties the knot in February.Covid cases in Australia are reaching record heights as Omicron clubs together with other strains and lts infections to almost , every day.In the clip posted on video-sharing app TikTok, the soon-to-be we hugs several men and other women boogying on the dancefloor - hoping to catch Covid so it doesnapost impede on her nuptials. She captioned the clip, which was titled Catch Covid not feelings, saying: POV your wedding is in six weeks and you still havenapost had Covid. Experts across the globe have warned of the dangers of going out of your way to catch the disease - which has killed millions worldwide. At the start of December, one catch-Covid party in Norway ended with a record  to  people infected with the then-unresearched Omicron strain. The woman may not get another chance to risk her health after the state of Victoria rolled out temporary bans on dancing indoors to slow Omicronaposs spread. Other bachelorettes hoping to save their big day, and potentially thousands of pounds, commented on the video. One woman wrote: Feb  bride and I feel this on so many levels. Another said: We need to do this before your engagement just in case.Speaking to the Daily Mail, an infectious disease expert warned the public against trying to catch Covid deliberately.Dr Catherine Bennett urged people to avoid being infected for as long as you possibly can. The epidemiologist added that people actively trying to get infected when they could ride through the current surge isnapost wise. Weaposre hearing lots of people say aposit might be mildapos but itaposs actually really terrible, soyou can avoid it, do, she added. She advised people get a booster shot as a more sensible way of swerving the more severe aspects of the virus. news world-news labrador-learns-incredible-new-trick-"Assistance Labrador has learned amazing trick to help deaf ownerByCatherine Swan:,  Jan | commentsAn assistance dog has wowed viewers on TikTok after showing off an incredible new trick she has learned to help her deaf owner.The heartwarming clip posted by@milathehearingdogshows the way that three-year-old black Labrador Mila lets her owner know that someone is calling her name.Owner Mary Vanderbloemen, from Texas, USA, explains in the video’s captions that Mila has learned a “name call alert”, and goes on to show how the clever pup carries this alert out. As a friend behind the camera calls Mary’s name, Mila is seen quickly heading over to her owner and nudging her knee with her nose until she gets her attention. When Mary asks her what she wants, waggy-tailed Mila shows Mary who is calling her by going back over to her friend and giving their knee a firm nudge.  The talented Lab is a hearing dog, a type of assistance dog trained to alert people who are deaf or hard of hearing to sounds around them.Mila also alerts her owner to fire alarms, emergency sirens, her keys dropping, and “much more”, Mary says, who told adoring Mila fans on TikTok that she’s “so proud” of Mila and that having an assistance dog is “le changing”.Over , people follow Mary and Mila’s uplting TikTok account that shows what it’s like to have a hearing dog, and Mila’s newest trick has been viewed more than five million times on the social media . Impressed dog lovers were quick to praise the Lab’s latest work. “She’s so smart!” one person said over Mila’s name call alert. “I’ve never seen this task before!” another commented. “This is so cool.” Mila isn’t the only dog who has been melting hearts on TikTok lately by showing the incredible ways assistance dogs help their owners each day.This German Shepherd stunned viewersafter a video posted by@official_call_me_blueshowed the well-behaved pup helping to do her US veteran owner’s shopping in a busy supermarket.Dog lovers were left amazed by service dog C.C’s ability to fetch items for her owner off the supermarket shelves, even picking out his favourite brand of coffee with ease. title: tenerife raises covid alert level
story: Tenere raises Covid alert level with Brit tourists forced to endure more restrictionsThe new alert level  came into operation at midnight in Tenere with the introduction of increased regulations in pubs, hotels, restaurants and on public transportThe new alert level  came into operation at midnight, with the introduction of increased regulations in pubs, hotels, restaurants and on public transport Image: Getty ImagesByRita Sobot:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments British tourists holidaying in Tenere will be subject to a raft of new restrictions after spiralling cases prompted authorities to raise the coronavirus alert level to “very high risk”.A new alert level  came into operation at midnight, with the introduction of increased regulations in pubs, hotels, restaurants and on public transport. The maximum number of people allowed to meet up indoors or outdoors is set now at six and Covid passports have to be shown to get inside all establishments as a mandatory measure. And the responsibility to inspect these, either on paper or digital, remains with the owners. The Canary government has raised the alert after looking at all the health data and the increasing pressure on hospital beds.  The increased measures will remain in force until at least January  when they will be reviewed again. In most places, capacity levels will be cut to  per cent outdoors and  per cent inside to avoid crowds. Only six people can sit in groups, unless they are living in the same households. Pubs and restaurants will now have to close at midnight and public transport capacity is  per cent. On Sunday, , new cases of coronavirus were reported in the Canary Islands and nine more deaths, six of them in Tenere. The accumulated incidence at seven days in the Canary Islands stands at ,. cases per , inhabitants and at  days at ,. cases per , inhabitants. The alert has also been raised in La Palma and Lanzarote to level , whilst the rest of the islands continue for another week with Gran Canaria and Fuerteventura at Level  and La Gomera and El Hierro at Level .In the archipelago as a whole, there were , new cases of Covid- detected in the last week, representing an increase of .% in the daily average of new cases.The soaring number of cases is put down to the same trends as being experienced across Europe and the dominance of the new Omicron iant.President of the Government of the Canary Islands, Ángel Víctor Torres says he is very concerned about the tremendous saturation that is taking place in the health care services across all of the islands due to the six wave of coronavirus. There is hardly any family that does not have a member who has tested positive, he said. It is not an exceptional issue in the Canary Islands, it is happening all over the world. news world-news tiktok-viewers-tears-labrador-sends-"Owner’s late dog ‘tells’ new puppy to ‘take care’ of ownerByCatherine Swan:,  Jan | commentsA TikTok video has left viewers sobbing after a dog owner shared a touching tribute to their beloved late Labrador.When their Labrador Joe sadly passed away, the owner welcomed home French bulldog Kevin - and in the heartbreaking clip posted by@kevin_the_frenchie , they imagine a conversation between the pair.“She talks about you all the time,” reads a caption while adorable Kevin is on screen. “And she misses you a lot.” The video then shows elderly chocolate Lab Joe, with the caption: “That’s why I sent you to heal her heart. Take care of her for me.” Kevin and Joe’s owner admitted that they were “bawling” making the video, and urged people in their comments to “cherish every single day with your fur baby.”  Thousands of TikTok users were moved by the emotional video, with owners sharing their tragic experiences of losing their own beloved dogs. “I know how much you miss him,” one person commented. “My Maxy, same story and a chocolate [Labrador]. I can think of him now without crying, sometimes.”“Our animals ’ hearts can go on living longer than their bodies,” another said. “I miss all mine watching over me.”Others acknowledged the bittersweet experience of getting a new puppy after losing a dog. “This made me cry so hard,” a third person admitted. “I’m in this same boat. Just got a new baby after losing my previous one back in June.” “We lost our boy in March to lymphoma,” another added. “And he just sent us a new boy who needs extra TLC.” Kevin and Joe aren’t the only dogs who have left TikTok viewers in tears lately. More than three million people were moved by an uplting video of Rottweiler Pluto, which showed how it might look to have your dog greet you in the afterle. Captioned: “You arrive in heaven, this is how your best friend greets you,” the emotional clip shows Pluto bounding through a field towards the camera in slow motion, a happy grin on his face. “I instantly started sobbing watching this and thinking about that day,” one person commented on the tear-jerking video. “Tears in my eyes - I really hope this is true,” another added. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access The Courier and the EveningePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to The Courier or the EveningePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on    Monday – Friday, am – pm, or email.Your subscription to The Courier will allow you to access all of the Eveningstories which are now available on The Courier website. All of the best Eveningcontent, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on The Courier website and will be available for you as part of your subscription. If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Courier ePaper.The new website is now live. Eveningcontent can now be found on The Courier website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. story: COMPASSIONATE and dedicated, Dr Margaret Kerr’s work in Glasgow saved the lives of hundreds of premature babies. The consultant paediatrician at what was then the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill was a leading light in neo-natal medicine. She once said in an interview with the Evening Times: “I love babies – we are no longer just saving le but producing healthy future citizens. That gives us all pride and pleasure.”

title: anm group teams up with aberdeen university for farm energy project
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days.
